message:
Hi there,
I'm beginning to learn Prolog programming language, but my problem is that I don't know where to start ?!
I knew that it derived from the predicate logic, so am I supposed to learn about it before or what ?
up to this point, I tried to learn it from the documentation which comes with the visual prolog but, unfortunately, it is messy and the language seems to be mind-blowing to me !
so, anyone here can recommend me any suitable books or tutorials for it ?

data.message: I can give you my lecture slides if you want , but at first why would you like to learn it ? if you're willing to study AI most of the courses now are in Python , prolog is not efficient as modern programming languages , but if you're looking for understanding the logic programming concept just pass your course , and don't waste your time , this is my advice :)

I know :D focus in just passing , btw I didn't write a single line until now , and I passed my mid terms you can search for learn prolog in 1 Hour on youtube , and I will give you my lecture slides if you want

الكورس دا لطيف 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMm8EjqH1EFW9Faldu6D6Uh2j1EWWaTYe
مبني على كتاب Programming in Prolog 5th Edition 

أفضل حاجة شفتها كمقدمة لل Logic Programming كتاب Thinking as Computation فممكن تقراه الأول ومتناس تبص على كتاب Logic Programming with Prolog
I'd start by studying an AI course first
Start form wikipedia then expand from the foot notes links https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prolog
